sentences.en: A long illness had emaciated the invalid.
A long illness have emaciated the invalid.
sentences.cn: 长期卧病使这病人瘦弱了.

sentences.en: A long time illness made him sallow and emaciated.
sentences.cn: 长期患病使他面黄肌瘦.

sentences.en: And he struck his breast with his emaciated fist.
sentences.cn: 腾格拉尔说,他用他那瘦削的拳头捶着他的胸膛.

sentences.en: Emaciated indicates a serious condition resulting from starvation.
sentences.cn: emaciated指因饥饿造成的严重状况.

sentences.en: EXMP : She was emaciated by long illness.
sentences.cn: 由于长期生病她变得消瘦了.

sentences.en: He was emaciated by long illness.
sentences.cn: 他由于长期生病而瘦弱.

sentences.en: His limbs were nearly frozen, and his body dreadfully emaciated by fatigue and suffering.
sentences.cn: 他四肢几乎冻僵了, 身子因倍受劳累和苦难的折磨,已脱去了人形.
她在做化学疗法过程中日益消瘦.

sentences.en: She was emaciated by long illness.
sentences.cn: 长期的疾病把她折磨得瘦骨伶仃.

sentences.en: That poor guy has become emaciated from taking heroin.
sentences.cn: 那个男人因为吸白面儿已经瘦得不成人样了.

sentences.en: The animals had lost weight noticeably, becoming lean, almost emaciated.
sentences.cn: 那些动物体重明显下降, 瘦多了, 简直是憔悴不堪.

sentences.en: The prisoners were ill and emaciated.
sentences.cn: 囚犯们疾病缠身，骨瘦如柴。

sentences.en: Your two hands are seizing that emaciated purple tulip tightly.
sentences.cn: 你用你的双手紧紧地抓住那朵瘦弱的紫色郁金香.

trans.tran_en: extremely thin from lack of food or illness

trans.tran_cn: 使消瘦，使衰弱( emaciate的过去式和过去分词 )
